total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (2, 5, 1, 8) in each row, with some rows being entirely filled with 1s.

Q2: Identify the changes made in the output grid compared to the input grid. The pattern seems to be maintained with the exception of certain areas where the pattern is interrupted by a sequence of 0s.
Q3: Identify the rules for when and where the pattern is interrupted by 0s. It seems that the pattern is interrupted in the same column for several consecutive rows.
Q4: Identify the rules for how the pattern resumes after the interruption. It seems that the pattern resumes with the same sequence of numbers (2, 5, 1, 8) after the interruption.
Q5: Apply the identified rules to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.

Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (2, 5, 1, 8) in each row, with some rows being entirely filled with 1s.
Q2: Identify the changes made in the output grid compared to the input grid. The pattern seems to be preserved except for a block of zeros in the middle of the grid.
Q3: Determine the size and position of the block of zeros. It seems to start from the 19th column of the 9th row and extends to the 23rd column of the 22nd row.
Q4: Determine the rule for replacing the numbers with zeros. It seems that all numbers within the block are replaced with zeros, regardless of their original value.
Q5: Apply the identified rules to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
